ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Somethin seems wrong (long response)
ygData.msgSnippet: One thing everybody must learn, prices can ALWAYS go down and NEVER go up. Don t take never literally, though. We need to raise prices on banded. 7 for
ygData.messageBody:
One thing everybody must learn, prices can ALWAYS go down and NEVER go up. Don't
take never literally, though. We need to raise prices on banded. 7 for gorgets,
8 for bracers, 11 for masks, 13 for helmets, 12 for sleeves, 12 for mantle, 20
for mail, 20 for cloak, 12 for belt, 19 for leggings, 11 for boots. These prices
give us significant profit on 100% success and help even out the profits for
when we fail. If ALL of us sell at these prices and stick to them (don't let
them drop you more than a plat), then the 'low priced' banded sellers will be
very scarce indeed. Then you can see the 'wait an hour' frustration on the
buyers end. If someone auctions they are willing to pay 5 plat for a banded
bracer for over an hour, they'll be frustrated enough to give up and pay the
damn 8 plat. If we have a set price that majority follows, then we will still
sell. While the discount smith might sell 10 gorgets at 2 and a half plat profit
each, we'll sell at LEAST 5 gorgets in the same amount of time for 5 and a half
plat profit each. They might be making 25 plat, but we're making 27.5 and have
less chances for a failure :) If we group together and work as one group of
dedicated smiths, we can only win. If we become bitter enemies over who has the
lowest price, the price war will just destroy us all. We will ruin the value of
smithing. NO MORE DISCOUNTS!!! :)
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

Lemac Justerian wrote:

> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> I agree with the pricing problems of banded... I too have had to watch some
> smiths selling banded armor at what is basically the cost of materials!
> (not the actual cost which would take into account the time and cost to
> learn smithing)
>
> >From time to time I too have sold some cheap, but it is usually when I have
> made way too many of something and had it on me way too long... So, I need
> to get rid of some of the 'old' stock...
>
> But I think the real problem with the pricing comes not from overstock, but
> mostly from impatience. People think that they should be able to /Auction
> 1-2 times and that if nobody answers them, they want to go to the next zone
> ("where there are more people") to try to sell there... Then, when nobody
> wants to buy right away, they start discounting it to the cost!
>
> People, you have to understand something about selling... IT TAKES TIME!!!
> Just like the smithing itself does...
>
> If you have ever been in a fine clothier or jewelery store, you might have
> noticed that there isn't a whole lot of customers 'shopping' around
> inside... They are there selling a quality product for a good profit... that
> is the way they make their money and keep their reputation of a fine
> product...
>
> Much different then Sears or some warehouse store that is basing sales on
> HUGE Volumes because they (vendors) get huge discounts on the items
> (Materials cost)...
>
> Well, remember folks, this isn't Kmart!! Don't try to sell at Kmart
> prices!!
>
> I often hang out at the banks or gates of a city selling my wares... and
> there have been times when I sat there for 5 min or more without selling a
> thing, or even getting a query as to the prices and such! This can seem
> veeeery frustrating... but look at it in a different light:
>
> Last night I spent about an hour selling banded armor... and guess what? I
> made about 30 plat in profit (over costs of the materials, not actual
> costs - I am about even now... hehe...) How long would it take you to earn
> 30 plat in, say, Unrest? or NRo? Probably at least twice as long, and only
> if you got some good loot off some mob! If you can just relax and sit back
> and sell armor for a couple of hours, you can make about 30-50 plat per day
> just off of that... Then you won't mind going to those places where you earn
> lots of experience, but get no good loot... Because it will allready be in
> the bank!
>
> So, remember... Keep those prices up there for a GOOD profit... and RELAX!!!
> Take the time needed to sell... Just because there are only 14 people in
> NFP and nobody buys from you in the first 5 minutes doesn't mean that 5
> minutes later the SAME 14 people will be in that zone! They change all the
> time.... just look at the names... Oh, and if you see some that are there
> for a long time, they are probably selling too!
>
> Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
> Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com
>
> > From: "Scott Searle" <sasearle@...>
> >
> > I think this was directed at my comment about doing scalers, lanterns, and
> > skewers till trivial, and by then you'll be popping out the banded. The
> > comment was intended to mean at 115 you'll be popping out the banded
> (which
> > is where skewers were trivial for me). If it wasn't, then disregard.
> >
> > As far as selling banded...I have all but stopped playing my enchanter
> > because I got burned out on all the requests for armor. I logged him in
> > last night and within 5 minutes was hit with 4 requests from return
> > customers. This was after taking 10 days off from the game. I politely
> > refused all 4 requests and promptly rolled up a new enchanter so I could
> > actually do something besides standing behind a hot forge making armor.
> > Sometimes making money is less important than doing some hard core
> > adventuring, though RP'able situations seem to present themselves more
> when
> > you play the role of a traveling salesman (or salesperson for you more
> > politically correct types).
> >
> > If you want to build your business, travel. I have hit every remote
> region
> > of the world and sold jewelry, armor, and other miscellaneous wares there.
> > I sold one high elf fellow a polar bear cloak and got a tell from him two
> > days later asking for a full suit of banded. I mentioned my recent first
> > success in making silver-jade mana rings and added another 12pp to the
> sale
> > on the spot.
> >
> > If you really want to make money on trade skills, do several of them, and
> > pick up critter dropped items or quest items as you travel and sell them
> to
> > the other side of the world. I've made a lot of friends and a ton of
> money.
> > I laugh now when someone asks me how in the hell a 13th level enchanter
> can
> > afford a dragoon dirk (and crookstinger), skull of Jhen'tra, polar bear
> > cloak, mana rings, golden ear studs, and various other assorted goodies.
> If
> > they only knew there's a few hundred plat, a full set of bronze, two sets
> of
> > banded, a runed totem staff, and two or three sets of all my research
> spell
> > components through 29th level sitting in my vault. That's all after
> outfitt
> > ing my wife and 4 buddies with full sets of banded at cost, and a few
> > donations made to the young here and there.
> >
> > No, I hardly think the banded market is dead. It's been damaged a bit by
> > low priced swindlers running through town selling gorgets for 3pp each and
> > bracers for 4pp each. Nothing like telling someone that a tunic will cost
> > them 20pp only to get the reply "there's a guy that comes through here
> every
> > week and sells them for 12pp, so I'm not paying a penny more." That's
> fine.
> > Within the hour I sell it for 17 to 20pp depending on how much haggling
> the
> > victim..er..I mean..person does and whether or not I've done business with
> > them before.
> >
> > There's a term that fits trade skills pretty well, diversity. If you put
> > all of your money in one trade skill and expect to buy everything you ever
> > wanted with it within a week, well, good damn luck to you. Myself, I
> funded
> > my jewelry making with my smithing, and my smithing was funded by selling
> > polar bear cloaks and similar quest items. Now that I'm pretty much set
> > financially for a while, I'll go back to killing stuff and making levels.
> > It's going to be nice to buy all of my 16th level spells as soon as I hit
> > 16th. The best part is, I've gotten a lot of invitations to hunt from my
> > customers, so I don't think I'll have trouble finding a group to help me
> hit
> > the next dozen or so levels. :)
> >
> > Just my 2 cents.
> >
> > Draethar
> > High Elf Enchanter
> > Accomplished Jeweler, Master Smith, and Traveling Salesperson of Innoruk
> >
> > >From: XxKommiexX@...
> > >
> > >scalers are trivial at 41, no way you be popping out the banded at that
> > >level. Oh ya, no one wants banded anymore, so it is really pointless to
> try
> > >and sell anything. In what I have seen on my server, most people want
> > bronze
> > >armor. You can still sell, but a lot more diffucult to do so.
> >
> >
> >
